member.name: ITaskbarList.ActivateTab
member.summary: Activates an item on the taskbar. The window is not actually activated; the window's item on the taskbar is merely displayed as active.
member.param: A handle to the window on the taskbar to be displayed as active.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: ITaskbarList.AddTab
member.summary: Adds an item to the taskbar.
member.param: A handle to the window to be added to the taskbar.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: ITaskbarList.DeleteTab
member.summary: Deletes an item from the taskbar.
member.param: A handle to the window to be deleted from the taskbar.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: ITaskbarList.HrInit
member.summary: Initializes the taskbar list object. This method must be called before any other methods can be called.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if successful, or an error value otherwise. If the method fails, no other methods can be called. The calling application should release the interface pointer.

member.name: ITaskbarList.SetActiveAlt
member.summary: Marks a taskbar item as active but does not visually activate it.
member.param: A handle to the window to be marked as active.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: ITaskbarList
member.summary: Exposes methods that control the taskbar. It allows you to dynamically add, remove, and activate items on the taskbar.
